characters: CATES LEADS HAMMOND OUT. THEY HEAD FOR CATES' BATTERED

dialogues.speaker: OPEN COUNTRY
dialogues.text: Endless green hills bisected by a ribbon of highway. A ro gang clearing brush by the side of the road... Twenty-fiv men in prison fatigues sweating through their mid-afterno labor.

dialogues.speaker: THREE GUARDS
dialogues.text: Flank the working prisoners... Mountie hats, shotguns, sidearms, sunglasses; they look like they mean it.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: A battered pickup appears...approaches. Suddenly, it coug shudders, stalls. A big Blackfoot Indian named BILLY BEAR gets out and starts cursing and kicking the vehicle.Then begins walking toward the road gang...

dialogues.speaker: ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: BRADY is the Guard near the center of the work gang; he smiles at the oncoming man, pokes a prisoner beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder what reservation they let him off of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoner is GANZ who looks up, grins at Brady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there goes the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brady laughs as Billy Bear closes in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, buddy, my engine's overheating and I got 30 miles before the next station... Could I get some water out of your cooler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz leans on his hoe, speaks as Billy passes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you shoulda stole a better truck, Tonto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a real big mouth, convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, chief.  He's just joking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firewater, Tonto?  Is that what you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy whirls, swings at Ganz. Both men roll to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER GUARDS
dialogues.text: Seeing the commotion, they run toward it.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ AND BILLY
dialogues.text: As they struggle, Billy slips a pistol into Ganz' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a state prisoner, asshole...! Back off...

dialogues.speaker: ROADSIDE
dialogues.text: Brady pulls Billy away from Ganz just 'as one of the othe officers arrives... Ganz suddenly whips out a pistol, sho Brady at point-blank range. Before the other Guards can e react, Billy comes out with his own pistol, caps the Seco Guard.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD GUARD
dialogues.text: Still forty yards away... In mid-draw, be howls as a bull from Ganz breaks the nearby ground. He fires, then turns runs for the prison bus.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Smiling, fires twice. but the range is too great for pist work...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER PRISONERS
dialogues.text: Watching....Then they all scatter in different directions

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Hefts his weapon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the big Indian run to the pickup, climb in and roa away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THIRD GUARD making a call on the police radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APO 657, Unit 25 to APO 478t APO 657t Unit 25 to APO 478.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Unit 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escape in progress. Two officers shot off rail crossing 31. Prisoners escaping. Two men, one six-four, 200 pounds, dark, an Indian, the other, Albert Ganz, five-ten...

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Several miles from the escape... A big semi parked by the side of ttie road; back doors to the closed trailer open. station wagon parked across the road. The pickup appears, approaches the semi, slows down and drives up the ramp in the van. Ganz and Billy jump out, shove the ramp up insid the truck and close the big doors.

dialogues.speaker: STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: Ganz and Billy climb inside ancl roar off, back in the direction of the road gang.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEAR
dialogues.text: Takes off his hat, puts on a baseball cap and sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz dives for the floor. Three police cars go by, sirens blaring, lights flashing. They pass the road gang. Ganz reappear, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something? I'm having a real good time.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The station wagon blasts down the pavement... Becomes a s dot on the landscape. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: A DOORWAY
dialogues.text: the portal slams open revealing a man holding a huge pistol,jack cates, s.F.P.D., a large and powerful man... stealthily moves up a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: He stops at the top of the stairs... Listens gun still re A continuous sound of running water... Cates moves toward bathroom. Rips the door open.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The shape behind the shower curtain freezes. Cates, gun h level, moves forward... Rips the shower curtain open. Revealing a young and very beautiful woman, ELAINE MARSHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Jack Cates, S.F.P.D.... And you're wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine stares at him as Cates turns off the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I wanted for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't answer questions, I ask 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment as she continues to stare at his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think your gun's loaded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world. You gotta ask yourself just one question. Are you feelin' lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't think it's loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine shakes her head and smiles, folds her arms over he breasts, shivers a little... Cates looks at the cylinder, spins it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way I see it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be puts the gun down on the edge of the sink, embraces he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Cates in bed with Elaine.  She wears his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy in the bar called me a dumb bitch today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irrigated his face with the shot of J and B I'd just poured him. Then I tried to deck the sucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he got the message...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I sit back and I think, I mean, who's to say I'm not a dumb bitch.  I work in a bar, right? I can't read a list of my academic credentials to every booze-hound that comes in the place... You are what you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive self-image problem all over again ... You are who you decide you are unless you're the type that lets assholes decide for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the one that thinks all psychotherapy is bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do think all psychotherapy is bullshit. But just because I think it's bullshit doesn't mean I don't know something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is your idea of sympathetic interest in my problems, I'll take brutal indifference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what I really think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me--I'm dyin' to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're ashamed to tend bar which is sad because you look great in that outfit they make you wear... You pull down four bills a week which is damn good, and you mix the best Pina Coladas I've ever had... I think that if you need bigger and better things ... then go for em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him after this. It looks like they'll kiss. Their faces are close.  Then she lightly moves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oversimplify every...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops her in the middle of the sentence by kissing her then pulls back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things are simple, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces are very close ... but they don't touch for another second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: SAN FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: Titles continue. Tugs churning across the bay... Quiet city streets. Parke cars covered with early morning dew... A newspaper truck slowly grinds by, drops a bundleand moves on.

dialogues.speaker: EMBARCADERO
dialogues.text: The station wagon pulls up to a young punk, HENRY WONG, o motorcycle. Billy Bear smiles and leans out the driver's side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got somethin' for us, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry produces some credit cards.  Billy passes them to G for inspection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hot are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot?  Hey, they're not even room temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz snorts derisively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't complain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a lot to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, old times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll follow you.  Take it slow,okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz pockets the credit cards as Henry wheels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to drive awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't tired yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe after we get done with him I'm gonna buy us some girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean, buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz stares at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, dummy.  Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never paid for it in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better when you pay... they let you do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always let me do anything. I don't want to pay for it.  I never paid for it in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I say, okay? We'll pay for the girls and have a good time... Don't you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I trust ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: NORTH BEACH
dialogues.text: First light breaks over Telegraph Hill. A quiet row of Victorian townhouses now converted into apartments.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Cates is sprawled across the double bed; Elaine is on the verge of falling off the edge. Cates' eyes snap open.  A second later, his wrist watch alarm goes off.  He turns i off, gets out of bed and begins pulling on his pants. Ela sits up in bed, still wearing Cates' blue shirt... Cates picks up a robe as Elaine gets out of bed on the opposite side, throws the robe to Elaine... She takes off the shir swaps it for the robe and throws the shirt to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you let me come over to your place once in a while, you could put on a clean shirt in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I have any clean shirts at my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He buttons his shirt and heads for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Cates brushing his teeth at the sink, Elaine making coffe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's my toothbrush, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps brushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you ought to buy me one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I would if I knew when you were coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops brushing, turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.  And I've been coming back for quite awhile... Let's not hassle, okay?  And can I have a cup of coffee?  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours some coffee, hands him a cup and saucer... Cate pours some whiskey into it from a flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fairly crummy way to start a morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I got a fairly crummy day ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that makes a nice excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you don't know what the hell you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates picks his holstered .44 off a chair back and begins strapping it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you start with that attitude... it's like I don't know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to know?  What difference does it make?  I'm the guy in your bed the last three months.  I make you feel good. You make me feel good.  What the hell else do you want from a guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd stop trying to make me mad so I won't care for you... I wish you'd give me a little more of a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away, moves into the corridor near the stairwell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for this. I gotta go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands frozen... He turns back and looks at her; it's hard to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, I'm glad I'm in your life... and hell, with an ass like yours, I figure anything might be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is warmed up by the first part, amused by the second; approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something, Jack, you really are hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way I see it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want me to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for some reason, I'm sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer, kisses her..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you forgot this. Hands him his wallet and badge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess people ought to know who I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go down the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, wait.  Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a scarf around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's cold as hell out these mornings, and you know what the man said, the coldest winter I ever spent was the summer I spent in San Francisco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't kiss.  He nods appreciately, the scarf in hand he turns and goes.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Cates comes out of Elaine's apartment building, crosses t his whipped and battered  64 Cadillac convertible, notice parking ticket stuck under the windshield wiper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoves the ticket in his coat pocket, gets into the Caddi puts the scarf around the rear view mirror, starts the en and guns away...

dialogues.speaker: CITY STREET
dialogues.text: Cates driving the convertible; he comes down a hill and t toward the East Bay... TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDEN GATE PARK
dialogues.text: Henry Wong, seated on a park bench. Now very dead, a bull hole in the middle of his forehead. Billy Bear is seated to him on the bench reading the race form.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Using the telephone at an outdoor booth a few feet beyond bench.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: LUTHER and ROSALIE, a young couple, turn a corner.  A dar parody of all-American young marrieds.  They are bickerin usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked that carpet we saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya want me to do, go out and steal for the money?  I hated the color anyway; the color sucked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Billy and Ganz descend on Luther and Rosalie an pull them into their station wagon..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy has Rosalie by the mouth, gagging her with his big paw... Ganz has his gun at Luther's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise, Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya want?  I thought you were locked up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the money, asshole, what do you think?  The money that Reggie hid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talkin' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want that Indian to snap her neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mimes the gesture... snap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Instead of worryin' about Reggie, you better worry about me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me this, we were partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, go ahead, break it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't kill her.  I can get you the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get it until Monday. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chickenshit punk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest. The place we stashed it opens Monday morning. I can't get it till then. Monday morning, that's when it opens. After that, I'll get the money to you right away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz finally takes the gun from the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked you, Luther. You were always a lotta fun to hang out with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalie is rubbing her neck now that she's been released. Ganz gestures to Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're gonna keep her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther desperately doesn't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you can trust me. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to mess with us or go to the cops, I promise you, I'll put holes in her you wouldn't believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at Luther, pinches him on the cheek, shoves him of the car.

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: Stands shivering as it powers away.

dialogues.speaker: WALDEN HOTEL
dialogues.text: A small hotel on one of the quiet streets behind Union Sq

dialogues.speaker: A GREEN COUGAR
dialogues.text: Pulls up across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tha car arrives in front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalie is very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do to me in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz gives her a casual smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's where I'm gonna cut your throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just kiddin', you just keep doin' what I tell ya, you'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move out of the car, head for the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: A FRIZZY YOUNG BLONDE sits behind the desk in a mirrored entrance hall.  She reads a lurid paperback. Morning traf streams by outside as Ganz, Billy and Rosalie enter and approach the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need some rooms for a couple of nights...Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at Ganz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  We don't get many real customers, ya know?  Most people only stay an hour or two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passes a form across. Ganz signs it, Frizzy glances at hi signature then takes a key from the rack behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her young.  And tall. Nice legs. Legs are important. Then, real thin.  Yeah.  NO jeans-A dress? a nice summer dress.  You know I want her fresh... I'll tell you why, because I been hoein' weeds and makin' license plates for a couple of years... Yeah, I know you don't get it...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEAR
dialogues.text: Sees a couple approaching, he shoves the dead man down on bench and spreads the newspaper over his head.  The body looking like a typical park bum who has spent the night. Billy walks over to Ganz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I need one more for my pal. Yeah. Make her an Indian. No, not a turban, you know, a squaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy smiles, takes the Polaroid...

dialogues.speaker: POLAROID
dialogues.text: A close shot of the dead man with the bullet hole in his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Takes the photograph back from Billy and slips it into hi jacket pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walden Hotel. Third near Broadway. Tell them to ask for ... uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the hot credit cards out of his pocket, the name embossed on the plastic..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) G.P. Polson...P.O.L.S.O.N....Just be a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangs up. The two men head for a green Plymouth... TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number twenty-seven, Mr. Polson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them next door, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a slightly knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, hey, you got the whole floor to yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz sends her back a sharp look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your filthy ideas to yourself, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz picks up his suitcase, walks over to the nearest stairwell.  Billy and Rosalie follow... TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Bars starting to fill up with mid-day customers... A blac Chevy cruises past and stops further up the block. Two Plainclothesmen, VANZANT and ALGREN, get out of the car. they start toward the Walden...

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC CONVERTIBLE
dialogues.text: Pulls up near the two men. Cates climbs out of his car an walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fellas, what's happening? Radio said you guys had something on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, Jack ... Salesman named Polson had his credit cards lifted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algren nods over to the parking lot opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) One of Polson's cards rented that green coupe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too much for a big rough tough gunfighter like you to do on this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles at the verbal positioning he's used to with colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suspect packed or is this a laugher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five and dime stuff. Polson said a kid with a switchblade mugged him and drove off on a motorcyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I guess you two are experts at taking boy scout knives away from teenagers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we are, that means you can stay outta this one. We don't have any big need for the artillery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanzant's turn to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm just offering to help out... I like to watch real pros work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help, huh?  Sometimes your kind of help tends to leave the suspect in bad shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algren...mediator... soothes the competitive situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, relax ... Jack, you wanna come inside, fine... You can stake out the lobby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates, a bit disgusted at the politics of this moment, no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, it's your show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men move toward the Walden.

dialogues.speaker: WALDEN HOTEL LOBBY
dialogues.text: Frizzy Blonde still behind the desk. Still reading the lu paperback. Unaware as Vanzant and Algren approach... She looks up as they flash their badges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you guys were in last week. You better ask around.  I'm not supposed to be hassled... I got friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, park the tongue for a second, sweetpants, we just want to search a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you got a warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should of been a lawyer instead of a dumb skirt workin' behind a register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frizzy turns to find Cates standing beside her. He nudges aside. Starts going throught the register book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come on, what the shit is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking for a guy going under the name Polson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frizzy sits back down in defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, big deal.  Get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates finds the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Polson, room 27...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, his sister went up an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanzant turns to Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, like we said, you stake out the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Great. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not missing out on Dillinger. This punk just stole some credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates watches the two Detectives head for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vanzant and Algren move down the hallwayStop at the far e Both Detectives draw their pistols and approach a door.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Summer dress and undergarments scatteredon the floor. LIS lies naked under the covers. She matches Ganz's earlier requirements.Smoking a cigaret staring at the ceiling. Ganz remains on top of the blanke Still in his shirt and pants watching TV. Three sharp kno at the door. Ganz reacts as if he's received an electric shock. His hand goes under the pillow... Comes up with an automatic. Shoves it hard into Lisa's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's wrong?  I didn't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another knock. Ganz makes her move to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What do you want?  What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her dress and tries to pull it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now ask who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoves harder with the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vanzant and Algren stand back from the door. Guns held re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police... open up.

dialogues.speaker: R00M
dialogues.text: Lisa looks from the door back to Ganz. Then at the gun he against her. She's petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police business. Come on, open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile on Ganz' face. Almost as if he's enjoying the mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep stallin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm coming...hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vanzant and Algren waiting. Sounds of movement from withi the room.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Cates moves toward the foot of the stairwell. Looks acros mirror on the wall opposite. The entire lobby covered fro this spot. Every angle, including Frizzy.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Ganz gestures to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz belts her with his gun; she falls..Ganz goes through connecting door. Slips into the adjacent room.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Another Hooker cowers in the corner, pulling on her cloth She's a Mexican girl in a ridiculous 'Indian' outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que paso? Que esta pasando? No entiendo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy goes to where Rosalie is awkwardlytied to a chair w an electric dord.  He pulls her to her feet as Ganz moves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) When I say jump, girl, you better jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Vanzant reaches down, tries the knob.  Locked. Algren mov back, preparing to kick the door down.

dialogues.speaker: ADJACENT ROOM
dialogues.text: Ganz opens the door behind the two cops. Raises his pisto and fires. Billy's shots follow immediately. Hits Vanzant Algren rolls just as Ganz fires again. Wounded, he gets o three shots, then moves inside Ganz' room. Ganz and Billy for the elevator... Exchange two more shots with Algren. Mexican Girl begins screaming in Spanish...

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Cates draws his .44. Races up the stairs three at a time. Frizzy starts to frantically call the police.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Cates stops at the landing. Vanzant's body sprawled acros the hallway. Algren back in the corridor, still losing blood... Leans against the wall for support... Lisa stagg out of the room, screams. Algren points the gun toward th elevator. Indicating where Ganz and Billy have just fled. Cates starts back down toward the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Ganz and Billy, guns ready as the carriage jolts downward Rosalie is terrified, sobbing...

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Arrives at the halfway turn of the second staircase. He t the next flight in two jumps.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: As the doors open, Ganz gestures for Billy and Rosalie to wait as he heads for the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Cates literally flies into the lobby just as Ganz appears slams Ganz against a column, belts him across the neck wi his pistol. Ganz screams with pain, drops his gun... Cate again slams him with his pistol, felling him...

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Slides across the floor. CATES Senses something ... moves just as Billy appears be and fires at him. The bullet takes out a window. Cates di over the desk. Another bullet chews up the wood.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Frizzy has been standing beside her desk, screaming... Ca move and the accompanying bulletspanic her. She dashes fo safety... Cates gets to his feet behind cover. Sees Billy holding Rosalie by the throat. Frizzy begins to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll blow her goddamn head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates doesn't miss a beat. He slowly levels his .44. Take careful aim and starts to fire at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates' shot narrowly misses Rosalie. The bullet smashes i a mirror above Billy's head. Cates keeps moving closer, g pointed straight ahead. Billy pushes the pistol against Rosalie'temple. For the first time, Cates hesitates. They face each other across the length of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ALGREN
dialogues.text: Struggles down the remaining steps into the lobby. He sti holds his revolver. Dares not raise it towards Billy and Rosalie.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEAR
dialogues.text: Covers Algren from near the entrance.  He's confused, doe know what to do... He keeps hold of Rosalie.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: His eyes catch Algren's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  Drop it and we won't kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algren tosses his gun to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now, tell him to drop his Goddamn piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do it, Cates.  Goddamn it, do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates lowers his gun. Finally lets it drop to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick it over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates does; Ganz picks it up, smiles, looks at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Get the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then back to Cates as Billy runs out the entrance with Rosalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Your gun's just like mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill Cates. But first be glances at Algren. Then, almost casually, shoots him twice with Cates' .44. Algren staggers back. Dead before he hits the floor. Cate twists sideways just as Ganz fires. The bullet misses. Ag Frizzy starts screaming and struggling. Ganz swipes the w across the head with the gun. Her body slumps to the floo Police sirens can be heard in the distance. Cates makes a attempt for Algren's gun. A bullet splatters against the floor only inches from his outstretched fingers. The gun skitters out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lying son of a bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We didn't kill her ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz smiles. With your own gun, cop. How does it feel? Cates leaps int wooden phone booth. Ganz leisurely blasts away at the boo with both his and Cates' gun. Two bullets crash into the booth. Ganz moves to check inside the booth but sirens ar ominously near. Ganz finally retreats out the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Billy and Rosalie weave their way across street to the Cougar. They make a U-turn. Ganz runs out. Car pulls out, then the police cars and vans begin to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Chunks of wood on the floor. Shafts of light through a do bullet holes. Shattered receiver dangling from a cord. Ca wedged tight into the very top of the cubicle. He drops t the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: The police arrive. Swarm into the hotel. All eyes on Cate he rushes to Algren. Too late... Cates realizes Algren is dead. He cradles Algren's head as he stares at the arrivi TAC Squad and Patrolmen. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD ROOM DAY
dialogues.text: Cates walks in. Several Detectives gather around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops blown away by a credit card booster... that don't figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were good cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were good cops who fucked up and got careless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snotty YOUNG COP paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you say, Cates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what you say about all of us all the tine ... we're always the ones fucking up when you tell it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth hurts, doesn't it, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks at the Old Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to borrow a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OLD COP shrugs... looks in his desk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody steals your gun, you're supposed to file a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna tell me about police procedure?  Do me a favor, don't give me a bunch of crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess when two cops die on account of your fuck up you want to keep it as quiet as possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates loses it for a second, lands on him with both hands pushes him against a wall... The room goes quiet. Cates c down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cops don't intervene. They just watch.  Cates c down, straightens up. HADEN walks by, or, rather, speeds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates, I'll need to see you in five minutes, exactly five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Cop hands Cates a gun, a traditional Army .45...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you read me, Cates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden continues moving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.  I heard you, your voice carries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cates is examining the gun, RUTH, a lab technician, en and drops three 8 x 10's on the desk near Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates lifts the blow-ups, each one showing a different as of a spent bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lots of people getting shot with .44's lately ... Last year, it was Saturday Night Specials..now it's heavy stuff. People must be getting madder about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates starts pinning the blow-ups onto a large bulletin b on the wall. Nearby, at the same time (within Cates' line sight, within earshot), Lisa, the Hooker, is being interrogated by a POLICE-WOMAN who pulls the statement of the typewriter. Nearby, the Indian Hooker is being interrogated in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an accessory to Murder One, so you're going to have to do a whole lot better than what we got down here, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a break, huh? ... Look, I got there.  He was a trick just like any other for all I knew. That's all there is.  He didn't feel like sitting and talking. He was in a big hurry to get laid. I was with him about an hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates has gotten interested in the last part of this ... drifts toward her... A DETECTIVE comes through, begins distributing I.B.M. printouts to Cates, the other nearby officers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a print from the hotel room.  Guy's real name is Ganz, Albert Ganz.  A hitter from back East but he worked out here a few years back.  Armed robbery. Broke out of prison two days ago and capped two of the guards. A real animal.  Wait'll you see this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates reads the printout, then smoothly,imperiously, he t over the questioning of Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he give you a return match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he didn't like your performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a raincheck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the side, Ruth is pointing at the photos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll interest you, Jack...we've got something here from your gun... and these are from the first weapon Ganz used...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, produces the third photo.  Pins it beside the from the Walden Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect match for the markings from the first gun he used... but not from the Walden Hotel... fired at least six hours earlier...at point blank range... right between the eyes.  Found him on a park bench...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows him two more pictures.  Police forensics shots Henry Wong ... very dead on the park bench...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ya know, there are some very bad people out there in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it this way, Ruth.  If there weren't, what would there be for us to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa continues with the Policewoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... so I got there and took him down.  He started watching television and then you sensational people started banging on the door... that's all... except ... he's gonna give you guys a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks up as he hears that remark.  Notices KEHOE, another Detective, entering with a long suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he liked shooting cops a lot more than getting laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates watches Kehoe unpack the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what this guy Ganz had in the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every last bit of it.  The big guy's room was empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates and Kehoe start going through the suitcase.  Kehoe produces a speed loader for a .44...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy must have had a .44 like yours, Jack. Now he's got yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kehoe next produces several boxes of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cat was real serious about his artillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Attendant comes through, hands Kehoe a file. He opens shows the file to Cates who reads the name under the mug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy Bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backup man from the East Bay. Worked with Ganz a few years ago and sprung him from the road gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kehoe opens the second file.  Four mug shots are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all pulled a bunch of jobs with Ganz about four years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute... who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh ... Wong, Henry Wong.  He was in on the same job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates spins the file around so that both Ruth an Kehoe ca see it, throws the forensic shots down beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that's not the same guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ... Dick Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Ganz have a grudge against his old friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden comes out of his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in here, Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I wanna have a discussion about it with any of the ones still walking.  Can we find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the file. Cates checks the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of  em's in the slam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Cates ... Get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates walks into Haden's cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be left alone on this one. Algren was killed with my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I read the report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden shuffles some papers, seems to ignore Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the bastard's got my gun.  I want it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, come on, there is an official department policy about cop killings. Cop killers represent a special priority because any man crazy enough to kill a cop is a greater threat to an unarmed civilian... In other words, we can't seen like we're in the revenge business... I know, we all know the truth's a little different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates almost smiles at Haden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthing botherin' you besides losin' your gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It bothers me when cops get hurt while I'm makin' a play. I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be more of a team player and a little less of a hot dog on this one, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being a hot dog's worked pretty well for me so far... Besides, I got a lead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You're not a team player. You gotta do things your own way. Fine.  Nail this guy and make us all look good.  But you better watch your ass.  If you screw up, I can promise you, you're goin' down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really know how to send a guy out with a great attitude. He starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to get your ass shot to pieces. We got enough dead cops on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep it in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: CITY STREET
dialogues.text: Heavy vehicle and pedestrian traffic. Cates stands near a dog stand. Elaine joins him. Cates is eating a hot dog an studying a police file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great place for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, one of my favorites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made the front page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Guess it must have been a slow news day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, okay, fine, no problem... See, there's this kid in jail ... First thing I got to do is go up and see what he knows ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might come over to my place to recuperate.  I don't have to go to work until the day after tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to stroll down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nothing to recuperate from. There's a guy out there with my gun, and I want it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not happy with this attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, spare me the macho bullshit about your gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit?  I'll tell you about bullshit.  My gun's a real weapon in the hands of a real maniac who knows how to use it.  It isn't my macho bullshit that's killing people, my gun is ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jack, if you make everything your personal responsibility, you'll turn into a bad cop.  It's not a practical way to function...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get burned, two cops did. Listen, I'll tell you about personnel responsibility.  I like to get the job done right.  And if I don't get my job done right... I'm for shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes again ... the sacred job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  I'm not like you. I'm not gonna sit on my ass wondering what's right and what's wrong... There's a psycho out there killing people with my gun and I'm gonna get him.  Because it's my job. And if you don't get that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get that. The job first. Everything else, especially me, second. I get it. I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one asked you to like it... But that's the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON CELL BLOCK
dialogues.text: Cates and a GUARD on the upper deck approaching the door the cell block... The Guard shouts upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a huge metal clatters the door to the cell block ope

dialogues.speaker: CELL BLOCK
dialogues.text: Cates and the Guard go through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move forward together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's Number Twenty-two... You want company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard shrugs, stays by the door.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: He walks down the cell block. Inmates stare at him from inside the stark cells. They don't know who he is, but th can smell a cop. Cates stops at Twenty-two, looks inside. a bit startled. Obviously, Reggie Hammond has connections taste. The paint is fresh; there's framed prints on the w instead of pin-ups, and the overall feeling is that of a graduate school dorm rather than a prison. Cates turns, n to the Guard at the end of the cell block. He throws a sw and the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND'S CELL
dialogues.text: Cates steps inside. Hammond is at a table wearing a Sony Walkman and writing in some detailed ledgers with a fount pen. He's boogeying in his seat to the music. Sprawled on bunk nearby is LEROY, another black inmate close to Hammo age. Leroy is leafing through a copy of a skin magazine. doesn't even look at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates steps inside the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hammond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Cates leans over, hits the override button on Sony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hammond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond jumps, grabs his ears in pain ... He pulls the headset off and glares at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a name, cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try Cates.  And let's talk in private, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the Walkman to Leroy who dutifully puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, convict, I know all about you. Single.  No fixed address. No known relatives. One previous conviction. Armed robbery... six months to go on a three-year sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You here to write my life story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not likely, Reggie.  Maybe I just need some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates takes the forensic photo out of his pocket, passes across the table to Hammond.  He looks at it, hardly reac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Wong... My old pal.  He's looked better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes the photo back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, I got just six months before gettin' out of here.  Six months between me and freedom after bein' here three years... And I'm not gonna do anything to screw it up, includin' pee in the prison yard, knock up the Warden's daughter or rat on my old partners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates swings the cell door back open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, Reggie.  I thought maybe you were a smart boy.  But I guess if you were real smart you wouldn't be a convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, decides to play his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I can see a second-rater like you wouldn't be any help at all goin' up against a real hard case like Ganz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond jerks his head around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ganz the one who shot Henry? Cates, I asked you a question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I noticed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz is in jail.  He's gonna be there two years after I'm on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't work out that way.  He busted out with a big Indian. They capped two guards on a road gang. Nice meeting you Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, goes out. The door clangs behind him. Hammond j up and bangs on the bars, shouts at Cates' back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates, Come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates turns, saunters back, leans against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can deliver Ganz.  But you gotta get me outta here first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help you, man, but you gotta get me out.  I got to be on the street.  Get me outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal about you bein' on the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a lot to protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way you're gonna get Ganz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION.
dialogues.text: Cates typing several of official looking documents while seated across from a rather dour-looking bureaucrat named

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me borrow your pen, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handed over by Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to use your own name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins signing the documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, just remember one thing. If all this comes down, you don't know me.  I'm not gonna burn for you.  And I'll tell you something else.  If it all comes down, your ass is new-mown grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Hey, no sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over the papers. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB You got him for 48 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob studies the sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You got a big career as a forger if you decide to go that way, Jack...   I'll ring security.

dialogues.speaker: PROCESS ROOM
dialogues.text: The GUARD leads Hammond to a steel cage. Harmnond's now wearing a beautifully tailored plaid suit. The Guard shouts to ANOTHER GUARD on the far side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoner G21355 ... Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Send him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate slides open. The Guard geztures for Hairmond to enter. Hammond walks to the far side of the pen.  The fir gate closes, the second one opens. Hammond turns and walks over to Cates. The Guard comes up Cates, double checks his orders then unlocks Hammond's cu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta sign for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Hammond who smiles at him.  Then looks a Harmond's clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This prison gives out $400 suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?  This suit's mine.  It cost $900.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond dusts off a sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be after a killer, not a string of hookers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it may be a little out of date. You know, I got a reputation for lookingreal sharp with the ladies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates hands some papers to the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard walks away as Hammond feels Cates' lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could change this for something good...Get you lookin' sharp for pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to hear your jive. I already got that department taken care of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a girl... shit... the generosityof women never ceases to amaze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates slaps a cuff on Hammond's outstrethand, then puts t other on his own wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, no way.  Take off the bracelets or no deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get it, do your Reggie?  There isn't any deal. I own your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way to start a partnership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this.  We ain't partners. We ain't brothers.  We ain't friends. I'm puttin' you down and keepin' you down until Ganz is locked up or dead.  And if Ganz gets away, you're gonna be sorry we ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  I'm already sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates yanks on the cuffs.  They move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This your car, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like you bought it off one of the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's get down to it.  I did my part and got you out.  So now you tell me where we're goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I got a move for ya. An awesome move. A guy named Luther. Ganz'll be paying him a visit.  We go to him right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther was part of the gang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gang you talkin' about, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can read a police file, shithead, and quit calling me Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an expression man, don't mean nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates gets behind the wheel and kicks the engine over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn.  It happens to be my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what're you complainin' about? At least nobody's calling you shithead....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may call you worse than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates' Cadillac purrs into view, entering a deserted stre within a rundown neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond seated next to Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just up the street, the other side, over there ... Now, don't bother knockin' on the door. Luther ain't the kind of guy that looks for company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your pal nuts enough to take a shot at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther ain't the reliable type. I don't want you shot yet, Cates ... not before you been a help to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm helpin' you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Didn't you know that?

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there...232...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates double-checks his .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You better let me borrow one of those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handcuffs Hammond to the door handle.  Grabs the car keys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You just hang on.  And hope this big move of yours turns out to be something. Opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER'S VICTORIAN
dialogues.text: Cates knocks at the door. Nothing. Knocks again ... no response.. From inside, he hears a faint noise but no response to the knock. Holding the .38 in one hand, Cates tries the knob with the other. The door opens. Cautiously Cates steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long corridor ahead. No sign of Luther.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Moves down the corriaor, checks the rooms off to one side

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER LUTHER
dialogues.text: slips into the hallway behind Cates... Cates turns just a gets to the kitchen. Luther holds a gun. Cates drops to a crouch and aims the .38. Luther whirls and fires at Cates wood and plaster fly out all round him, Cates makes a run dive for the floor. Luther runs out before Cates has regainehis feet.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Luther rushes out the front door and heads toward the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Watches as Luther heads down the sidewaltoward him. As he starts to pass by... Hammond steps out suddenly... Flatte him with the car door. Luther drops, stunned. Hammond, st restricted by being cuffed to the door handle, reaches an grabs his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond, Drop the Goddamn gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond looks up. He sprints across the pavement. Aims hi gun at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit playin' cop and undo this cuff, Jack, I need to talk to this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you to drop the Goddam gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a whole thing about people pointin' guns at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just throw me the Goddamn gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long moment. Then Hammond smiles and tosses him Luther's pistol.  Luther groans. Cates puts his foot on Luther's b and pulls himself into a standing position, cuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther, I always told you the physical side of life wasn't your gig.  Look at you, all messed up... Course you never were much in the snappy dresser department, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates now has Luther ready to be questioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond turns to smile at Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening, Luther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet my travel Agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther leans forward, looks straight at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure ain't his fairy godmother... now I'm looking for Ganz...where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him for years. That's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just took a shot at me, asshole. I think you do know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a fuck what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates grabs the still open Cadillac door, slams it into Luther. He falls backwards. Cates looks at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this works pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to try it again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther sits up again, glares at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz and Billy got my girl, Rosalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I met her.  Now tell us something we don't know, like where they stashed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates slams the car door agains him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you he's having a ball with this car door, Luther... You'd better think of somethin' to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther besitates...flashes a look at Hammond, who sends h a silent fleeting reply.  Maybe Cates sees this. Maybe no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ... he wants me to help him skip town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno ... he's gonna call me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another look at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's gonna call me on...Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong with all this.  Cates isn't sure just w Not yet. He looks at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you better put him on ice, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta take that call ... if there is one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you let him run around till Tuesday, he's gonna run right to Ganz and warn him. Ain't you, motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther makes a play toward Hammond, who laughs, doesn't e flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Luther, are you angry with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates wrestles Luther into the back seat, turns to Hammon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the hell you're smiling about, watermelon. Your big move turned out to be shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAMMOND Just stares at Cates, keeps smiling... TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKING
dialogues.text: Two Uniforms follow a sullen Luther, Cates and Hammond to DUTY SERGEANT... Cates speaks to him through the small window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assault on a police officer with a deadly weapon.  Carrying a concealed weapon.  Resisting arrest, Disturbing the peace. Public nuisance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant begins typing out an arrest form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll think up a few more and file the report tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks back at Hammond as Luther is hauled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, I gotta make a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move through the honeycomb of office partitions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates picks up the phone on the other side of the booking desk. Dials ... waits for a response as TWO HOOKERS are l past by an Arresting Officer. Hammond gives them the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is Jack Cates. Any messages?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Elaine is on the kitchen phone, speakingwhite putting her coat on over her uniform for the evening.  One look at th way it is cut and you know why she hates her job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one.  Some lady called.  Said she's a little hot-headed sometimes... But she still wants her occasional roommate. She'd like to talk it over after she gets off work tonight... if it's humanly possible....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, look, I'm in the middle of sone stuff right now... I'm not gonna have time to come by. I don't know when I can get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face falls. Making the offer was hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack ... you're making me work too Goddamn hard at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is very irritated by this turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Goddamn it if you think I'm happy about it, you're nuts. I just gotta take care of a few things, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the way people who care for each other are supposed to behave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates says nothing.  She hangs up angrily.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKING
dialogues.text: Hammond is working on the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ladies, you seem to be in need of assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we got enough problems, we don't need no tight-ass court- appointed lawyer trying to bullshit us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, I'm not trying to bullshit you. I don't know whether or not you ladies heard but the city is coming down real hard on people practicing unlawful carnal knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you trying to say, fella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to say that you're not just walk in that courtroom and get gonna slapped with a $50 fine and be back on the street turning tricks tonight. You both are going to do some time. About 30 days each... Unless, of course,we talk real business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where do you want to do it, honey? You wanna hop up on the counter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can go to the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates walks over and pulls him by the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the move. Let's go. As they walk toward a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how close I was to getting some trim.  And you fucked' it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, my ass bleeds for you. And I didn't get you out so you could go on a Goddamn "trim" hunt... stop moaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speakin' of moans my Stomach is startin' to growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We eat when I say we eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit ... I ain't moving  till I get something to eat. You've been treating me like shit ever since I came out here.  If you don't like it, you can take me back to the penitentiary and kiss my hungry black ass good-bye.  And I want some food some place nice.. Some good people, nice music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm hungry too. I know of a place. Let's go eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I want mandolins, flowers... They move off down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond at a candy machine.  Cates drops in a quarter, throws Hammond a candy bar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your God-damn dinner. Now, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward a row of parked cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you call on the phone back at the booking station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in the car and keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond gets in the car as Cates readjusts Elaine's scarf the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must of been your lady friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates frowns at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You really do have onoe, huh, Jack... what's her problem besides you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got the same complaint as half the Goddamn population.  She can't get the job she's trained for and it pisses her off... Anyway, what the fuck do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates climbs in behind the wheel of the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, tell me about her.  In jail they got me surrounded by guys wearin' blue suits twenty- four hours a day.  And I ain't built for that. Really?  With the clothes you got on you look like you'd love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates takes a belt from his flask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, where we goin', convict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission District.  Gonna find us an Indian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates starts the motor, slams it into gear.  Accelerates to the street. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CITY STREET NIGHT
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammon booming along in the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jack.  I want to hear about your girl.  When were you with her last ... You get what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles. Cates smiles back at him, almost cruelly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give out the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, two nights ago, three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates keeps smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pained expression on Cates' face as he comes back to real

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Then we had a fight this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you took care of business and got the important part in before she came down on you...Tell me a little about her.  She got great tits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates gives him a hard look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the feeling it's going to be real long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep driving. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: MISSION DISTRICT
dialogues.text: The Cadillac drives slowly past a bar called Torchie's. Stops at the end of the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long shot, but...Billy used to tend bar here a few years back. I heard him talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This part of town, they'll make us for heat the second we walk in. Just back me up like you've got a piece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back you up?  Now why would I wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they kick my ass, they'll sure as hell carve yours up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can handle it all right, huh? Real amazin' how far a gun and a badge can carry some cats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  Attitude and experience get you through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond step out, glance toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been in a lot of bars where a white cop rousted me and some of the brothers. All those clowns ever had going for 'em was a gun and a badge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need five years training to handle a joint like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamnond's had enough of this debate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two problems.  Number one, I'm not playin' games.  Number two, you got nothin' to bet with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
