dialogues.text: If we come outta this joint with Ganz' phone number, or a dead Indian, or anything else useful, then you could turn the other way for half an hour while I get laid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Anybody that talks about women as much as you do probably can't get it up anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's never been one of my problems. Now, stop stallin', man, or else admit all this professional stuff you're talkin' about is a crock of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what happens if you lose... you tell the truth for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me what Ganz busted out for, he's after a lot more than just gettin' out of jail.  And whatever it is, you're part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. I just wanna see Ganz nailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bet's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond thinks it over..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if I lose, I'll tell you anything you want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates reaches into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna enjoy this ... here, I'll even loan you my badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said bullshit and experience are all it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the badge anyway as they head for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: TORCHIE'S WESTERN BAR
dialogues.text: They step inside. Hammond reacts to...

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK CITY
dialogues.text: Longhorns mounted over the bar, Rebel Flags, Lone Star Be armadillo posters. Even the waitresses wear Stetsons. Rockabilly pounding from the jukebox. A Cowgirl Stripper doing the grind on a small podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place don't seem real popular with the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kind of place. I always liked country boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles, finds a table in the corner. A Cowgirl come over to take his order.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Takes a deep breath, moves toward the bar. Smiles at the ol' boys. They don't smile back. He sits down at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better have a Black Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, I think I'll have a vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamnond looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: places a glass in front of him, picks up the dollar as Harmond flashes Cates' shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know a big Indian named Billy Bear?  He used to work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender shakes his head, gives him a scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond lifts the shot glass and throws it through the mi behind the bar. Sudden silence throughout the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now how's your memory doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.  I don't know what the hell you're talkin' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I better ask around, see what your pals think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit who you ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender walks down toward Cates.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Moves away from the bar. He stops at a booth occupied by

dialogues.speaker: FOUR COWBOY PUNKS,
dialogues.text: one a very big man.  Hammond grabs him by the arm and pul him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up against the wall, cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk breaks free, aims a massive haymaker at Hammond. Gets a right to the stomach for his trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now, I said get over there by that wall ... You hear me, motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Move it, rednecks.  On your feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the next by the arm, yanks him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Over there...move your ass. Some of you rednecks seem a little hard of hearing, so I'll repeat it for everybody... I need word on the whereabouts of an Indian that goes by the name of Billy Bear. It's a police matter and you all look like you'd just love to cooperate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CATES Quietly sips his beer. The other occupants of the b watch Hammond herd the four Punks to the end wall.

dialogues.speaker: A BIG COWBOY
dialogues.text: when Hammond isn't looking, he dashes toward the exit, Ca puts out a leg. Sends the Cowboy crashing into a crowdedt

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Turns around at the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That wasn't necessary, buddy. I got this under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us citizens are with you all the way, Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redneck Punks are now spread-eagled against the wall. Hammond searches the first. He drops a wallet on the floo and moves to the second. A switchblade, some credit cards another wallet fall to the floor. The last Punk has only roll of bills.  Hammond holds the money up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in trouble, big trouble, so you better start talking. Where'd a boy like you make a score like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine, what the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must a rolled somebody.  They don't let punks like you take jobs that pay this much ... you sure you don't know a dangerous Indian, because unless you start talkin' I may just have to start looking down your pants with a flashlight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of cop are you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your most terrible nightmare ... a bad nigger with a badge that entitles him to kick your ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond turns to the Bartender...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) One of them is under-age.  Another attacked a police officer. And you know I ain't found what I came lookin' here for yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks back to the Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The tall one had a weapon ... you want me to keep on makin' a list, or you got the picture yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for a towel under a pyramid of bar glasses. Je the towel, the pyramid capsizes onto the floor. Huge cras the glasses break into a million fragments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Looks like you're on your way to bein' outta business, redneck... Now, let's see what can we fuck with next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender doesn't have the look of a happy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  The Indian hangs out with a girl down the block. Right where Chinatown starts.  She lives on top of the hardware store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond turns, grins at Cates. As far as he's concerned, won the bet.  Cates nods, slips out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn about his girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, give me a break, you're going to have to settle for her place.  It's the only thing I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm tellin' ya, I'm giving you all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try obeyin' the law once in awhile, and I won't have to hassle you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to go, then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But remember this, cowboy, there's a new sheriff in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles, turns and goes. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Hammond steps out of the bar.  He crosses to Cates by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you got something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The gun you took off that redneck in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made that move, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While you're at it, You can give me the switchblade, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond reluctantly takes out a .22 automatic, slams it d on the hood of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Credit cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond hands them over with the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already got a gun and you owe me a piece of ass.  I'll settle for the gun you just took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment. Then Cates slowly lifts the .22 automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a real good job... Guess you deserve a reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removes the clip.  Throws it across the street. Hands Ham the automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure am. Now let's go get us an Indian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up the block. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Neon signs with Sino lettering.

dialogues.speaker: CATES AND HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Walk down the street, spot a shop with a window display o tools.  Look up at the darkened apartment windows. They w to the end of the block.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Stairwells lead to each apartment above the shops. Cates Hammond move along the buildings... Arrive at the back of hardware store. Quietly, they start to ascend the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: The metal steps extend onto a platform by the back door. Cates leans over the railings to look through the adjacen window. Between the drawn curtains, a flickering glimmer a TV set. On the tube, various poses from stridently exercising women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the shit is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks again. A female form passes by, goes out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be billy's girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Cates gestures to the door lock. Hammond fiddles with it several moments. The door swings open. They step into a darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Cates takes the .38 from his pocket. He stops near the op bedroom doorway. He looks at Hammond and then both men st quickly into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police! Nobody move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond reaches for the light switch. Takes a heavy blow. Slumps against the door. A Woman's voice screams out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stay where you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light goes on. Cates' gun points at a YOUNG WOMAN (CA in a flimsy dressing gown. Saturday Night Special held between her palms, police style... A SECOND WOMAN (SALLY) stands beside Hammond at the light switch. Larger and slightly older than the first, she wears a man's shirt. H a baseball bat in her right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better drop it or he's gonna get another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, talk to here jack.  I don't feel like gettin' number two along side of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said police.  Now drop the goddamn gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that police shit. You drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look, don't shoot.  I'm just reachin' for my badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates takes out his badge-Shows it to Casey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this bullshit. I've seen fake badges before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something lady, this guy is a real nervous cop - He's just liable to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates takes two steps toward Casey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I'm the calm type.  I know you don't want me to shoot you, and I know that you don't want to shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes two more steps toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shooting a cop puts you away for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You assholes better be real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Cates the gun. Sally prods Hammond with the baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait a Goddamn second here, let's see your badge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches the bat out of her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it.  Call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey walks over to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them it's Cates, Detective 31st District.  Then put your clothes on. If you don't answer some questions I'm taking both your asses in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Casey puts down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now, let's cut out the crap, which one of you sees Billy Bear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business, cop.  The son of a bitch isn't here, and he isn't coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to Casey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to go with him...I don't know where the hell he is.  I haven't seen him for two weeks. And I don't think I will.  He owes me money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Goddamn lowlife, the way he treated her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a real stormy romance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't much care what it sounds like to you, Cop. All I know is that I went a few laps around the track with him and I ended up with nothin' but the short end of the stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks over at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  Maybe these ladies would like to go a few laps with us.  How about it? I been nearly three years in prison and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannond starts for the door with Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you find that bastard, Billy, tell him to stay out of my life. I don't need any more of his macho bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: STREET CHINATOWN
dialogues.text: The two men walk among the bright neon lights. Neither of them very happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sucks.  A maniac gets hold of my gun and goes all over the streets killing people with it. So, instead of me being where I oughta be, which is in bed giving my girl the high, hard one, I'm out here doing this shit, roaming around with some overdressed, charcoal-colored loser like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna leave, man?  Let me take care of Ganz all by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?  Don't make me laugh.  You can't take care of shit.  You've been dicking me around since we started on this turd-hunt.  All you're good for is games... So far, what I got outta you is nothin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed with you too, Jack you did a real good job of busting up a couple of dykes bedded down for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther knew more than he told me and so do you...Now you better tell we what the fuck this is all about.  I gave you 48 hours to come up with something and the clock's runnin' ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long look at Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I don't like the way you ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a Goddamn what you think? You're just a crook that's got a weekendpass ... You're not even a name anymore. Just a spear- chucker with a Goddamn number stenciled on the back of his prison fatigues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk past. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: STREET ACROSS FROM TORCHIE'S
dialogues.text: They two men walk toward the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Reggie, I'm done playing around. I want to know what's going on and I'm going to beat the living shit out of you until you tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond goes into a street rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You beat the shit out of me? Don't make me laugh, sucker.  You don't know how I'd dance on your face?  I'll hit you so hard, so many times, you'll wish you'd never been hatched.  I'll turn your face into cottage cheese. I'll make your girl think you been takin' ugly pills.  She won't even know who you are, sucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop by the car. Cates takes the gun out, lays it on hood.  Hammond stares at him. Cates next takes out his wallet, shows Hammond his badge, then lays the badge on t car fender... Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the first thing I ought, to explain to you, nigger, is I fight dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hits Hammond a tremendous right hand full in the face. Hammond sags, grabs onto the car fender for support. Cate hesitates ... and Hammond kicks out, sending the partiall open car door slamming into Cates. Cates sprawls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond aims a kick at Cates' head.  Cates blocks it with crossed forearms, grabs, twists.  Hammond tumbles, rolls from Cates.  Both men struggle to their feet, circle each other. Hammond moves in only to receive twoquick blows from Cate a bit sooner than he expected.  Cates smiles. Hammond dances in and out... Cates' breathing becomes mor labored. His windmill attack penetrates Cates' defense. C clears his head, charges, bull-like ... His rush and grea bulk send both of them crashing into some trash cans and brick wall. Hammond is faster... Cates is much stronger; Both men on their knees. They loo one another. Silently, they move to their feet. Hammond's back is to a wall... Cates keeps him there, negates the lighter man's agility. They slug away, each now arm-weary Exchange a dozen blows. Finally, Cates steps back, arms a his side... Breath coming like a bellows... Hammond has to hold on to the wall; one more punch would him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you bastard, you going to tell me what's going on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puffing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... Do I have to kick the shit out of you some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand facing one another. Hammond smiles. A black-an white comes roaring up the street. Sirens howling, red li flashing, it slides to a stop. TWO UNIFORMED COPS jump ou guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you two.  Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, no...it's okay...I'm police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  Get your hands above your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps his gun trained on Cates,and Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gun and badge are over there. And I'm too fucking tired to raise my hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond rubs the side of his face. Cates falls back again the patrol car. Still fighting for breath. The First Cop lifts Cates' wallet off the Cadillac and looks at his bad shows it to the other cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates walks over, pockets his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a burglary call.  Two women say a couple of hoods broke into their place posing as cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was following a lead.  We rousted them... Go up and sweet talk 'em.  You can straighten it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Cop checks out Cates' badge and I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you do it?  We got better things to do than straighten out your messes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. I'll file a report tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Cop takes out his book, starts writing.  He's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta file a..Report tonight asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes with the territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Hammond and they head for the Cadillac. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: ALL-NIGHT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Cadillac parked behind the service area.

dialogues.speaker: RESTROOM
dialogues.text: Hammond looks' up at his bruised face in the mirror, then washes up.  Cates is one step ahead of him. He rolls up a piece of the wet towel and inserts it over his bleeding g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad we got interrupted when we did.  I was getting ready to finish you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates straightens up from the wash basin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.  You want to try again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, you'd just call your pals back to bail you out one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They saved your ass, convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing's for sure, Jack. That's how you'll tell the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates dries off his face, starts out of the washroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll even put it in my report that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes behind Cates. Hammond leans back toward t mirror, nudges a tooth with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: GAS STATION PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Cates leans on the Cadillac as Hammond emerges. Hammond starts for the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You come clean or we're going to go again.  Right here, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. A long moment; Hammond decides be has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been waiting a long time for some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles his meanest smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that for a number to give you heart failure? Guess you might start to get the picture after all. Mlaybe you're on the wrong side of the old law and order business..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates is unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me about the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my bunch hit a dealer in the middle of a sale. It's the kind of money nobody ever reports stolen. I was sittin' pretty, livin' in the high cotton, then somebody fingered me for another job. ... Some psycho who's out there capping people with some cop's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's after your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You catch on real fast...Okay, Jack, let's talk deal. How much of my money you gonna let me keep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We split 50-50?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not likely, convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna let me keep any of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on how things work out. I believe in the merit system. So far you haven't built up any points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, from now on, I'm gonna be real good, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the trunk of a car.  A lot better than under a mattress, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this. We ain't partners. We ain't brothers. We ain't friends. If Ganz gets away with my money, you're gonna be sorry we ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into the Caddy. Boom away. TRANSITION. The Cadillac moving through the city... Clock on the dashboard showing 4 a.m. Cates at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where's the goddamn car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real case, you know that, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This'll show you how smart I am. I got it parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...For three years?  Let's hope it wasn't a tow-away zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just drove by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac makes a screeching U-turn,i swings into the Cates leans out, looks at...

dialogues.speaker: PARKING BUILDING
dialogues.text: Narrow, multi-storied, with a garage-like opening and signals... proclaiming 'Weekly-Monthly-Long Term."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond gets out of the car. Stands on the sidewalk. Stretches. Then gets into the back seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're wired on benniest you get to stay up and stare at the building. I'm  tired, so I'm going to sleep. They take Sunday off. Place opens at seven o'clock Monday morning. Wake me up at a quarter till...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates stares at the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. You knew where the money was all along and all we had to do was come here and wait. I almost got my ass blown off twice tonight for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure the money was still there until we saw Luther. You almost got your ass shot off for nothing once, not twice, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: THE CITY
dialogues.text: Beyond the skyline, grey streaks of dawn etch the sky. TRANSITION. The Cadillac is pulled up facing the streets down the blo from the parking sections Cates walks in through the lot entrance. Threads his way between the lines of parked vehicles Tired and haggard, he carries a paper bag filled with quick-order food.

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Hammond stretches on the back seat.  Cates slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you sleeping on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond yawns, eases himself into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place opens in five minutes. Ganz ought to be here soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates tears the paper bag open. Passes a cup of coffee an donut back. He sips his own coffee, adds some whiskey fro his flask... pops another bennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took a big chance, leaving this here all this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  I figured Ganz was put down for a long time.  And I knew Luther would never job me on his own.  He's too chickenshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what?  Luther just got in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musta got some primo bondsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  That's a disgrace The guy pulls a gun on a cop and he's out in 24 hours.  I tell you some of the courts these days are just a fucking revolving door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther walks up to the window where a bored ATTENDANT rea a comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to pick up my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes across a faded form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant examines the form, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is three years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've been busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant opens a key file, begins rummaging in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't wash 'em, ya know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about chargin' the battery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we do. And we put air in the tires. I'll even sell you some gas if you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, just great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant finds the key, exits the booth. Luther foll to an elevated stack of cars. The Attendant throws a swit the stack of cars begins to move.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Luther drives down the exit ramp in a dated Porsche convertible. The car is covered with a uniform coat of dust, except fo the windshield which has been wiped hastily clean. Luther waits for a break in the flow of traffic, drives o Another street Luther turns onto a side street and then suddenly Cate's Cadillac appears ... starts to tail the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Cates follows Luther through several turns. The Porsche jerks whenever it speeds up or slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, look at all the dust on my car...why in the hell don't he take it to a car wash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know you darker people went in for foreign jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no choice. Some white asshole bought the last piece of shit skyblue Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think the guy'd be smart enough to know he was being tailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tryin' to save his girl, man. He's in another world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was his size and had Ganz on my ass, I'd  just leave town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you the man's in love... he wants to be a hero for his girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, does bein' in love make you stupid?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche. As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you'd never be like Luther and let a woman get to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let women get to me.  The quest for pussy is the meaning of life ... I got my own personal philosophy about 'em.  Keep women separate from guns, money and business ... women are for spending money.  They got nothing to do with helping you make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't philosophy.  That's common sense.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, do you always work people over like you did Luther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they don't tell me what I need to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it get... Tiring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in this 'cause it's fun. I'm not into hitting guys 'cause it makes me feel good either... I do it 'cause it works-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a very depressing view of life, man... you gotta smile once in awhile...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Luther hopes Ganz'll give him a piece of your money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's hoping that then he's dumber than I think he is, which would be amazin', cause I already think he's real dumb.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time agb Luther must of got the shit beat out of him so bad it just rattled his brain ... that would account for him making so many wrong moves in a row...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it doesn't look like he's gonna make it as a dangerous tough guy...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'd be embarrassed if I let my wheels go the way you've done with this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you don't understand is, I don't give a damn about how this thing looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No class...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class isn't somethin' you buy, punk. Look at you, five hundred dollar suit and you're still a lowlife.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The Caddy follows the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they follow Luther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting too close ... Cates, what's the matter, you been takin' dumb pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, most cops are pretty dumb... But since you're the one that landed in jail what's that make you?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: Luther pulls over to curb and parks.

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC
dialogues.text: suddenly swings over several lanes of traffic and parks i driveway of parking lot. LUTHER - CATES & HAMMOND'S P.O.V. He goes to the trunk. Rummages there ... picks up a flami red suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Goddamn suit is yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was in style a couple years back, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. if you ever switch from armed robbery to pimping, then you're all set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the suit is a nondescript attache case. Luther take it, closes the trunk. Beads down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the money, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump out of the car, follow on foot.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: Luther hurries along the sidewalk. He reaches the corner, turns quickly...

dialogues.speaker: CATES AND HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Following a little way behind. They pause at the corner, watching the pedestrian traffic move by. Then turn down the cross street after Luther. Fo him down a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY STATION
dialogues.text: Escalators and open stairwells. Luther enters and pauses the doorway. Commuters crowd the counters and congregate the stairwells. More people are seated along hard plastic seats. But no Ganz.  And no Billy. Luther moves further into the station.  Cates and Hammond enter. They keep Luther fixed between them, 50 feet ahead Luther seems to be wandering He walks through the shop ar and back toward the escalator. Hammond remains near the arcade while Cates blends in with the commuters. Luther p the briefcase down at his feet and leans against a counte Next to him, a loud troop of Boy Scouts marches by.  A cr of people from the train area below flows through the lob obscuring Luther from Hammond and Cates for a moment.  Ca steps out to get a better view and suddenly spots Ganz mo through the crowd toward Luther. Be looks over at Hammond across the station and motions.  Then they both start mov in on Ganz, trying to intercept him before he gets deeper into the crowd. Ganz moves cautiously through the station. A crumpled newspaper held absently in his hand. He scans the faces o the commuters and spots Luther. Fails to notice Cates and Hammond closing in on him from two directions. A PATROLMAN comes up. Starts chatting amiably with a Boy Scout next to Luther. Ganz hesitates in his approach. He motions Luther to move awaye, but Luther starts to panic he sees Cates and Hammond closing in... Ganz reacts to Luther, turns and spots the two men. He ma an immediate break for open ground. The Patrolman sees Ga start to run. The newspaper is thrown to the floor... Gan swings Cates' .44 toward Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz whirls, his feet slipping on the marble floor. His s at Hammond goes plowing into the ceiling. The crowd start panic and run in all directions. The Patrolman has al ready brought his own gun out. Level at Ganz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEAR
dialogues.text: Suddenly appears, Rosalie at his side. Billy Bear's .44 blasts the Patrolman onto his back. Ganz comes up and scrambles through the screaming patrons He, Billy and Rosalie head toward the escalator. Cates ha already brought out his .38... Can't get a clean shot thr the chaos. Hammond pushes his way through the crowd to Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot the sons of bitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates can't risk it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You don't want to chance it, then give me the gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bullshit. Then i'm staying with the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond starts after Luther. Cates turns, starts to aim a Hammond. Hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER WALKWAY
dialogues.text: Panic has overtaken everyone as they try to escape the ma with the gun. Ganz and Billy elbow and kick their way through the crowd tugging Rosalie along... Cates, gun in hand, creates further-panic as he moves aft Ganz. Ganz grabs a man beside him. Shoves him hard into the passengers in back. The man knocks over several more people creating a roadbl Ganz vaults over the railing and starts for the trains. Cates loses a few more precious seconds grappling through terrorized passengers...

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN AREA
dialogues.text: The usually jammed area looks like an empty stockyard. Th patrons huddle in fear against any available wall. Cates bursts out of the stairwell...

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Red and green signal lights. The light goes red, a train roars up and the doors hiss open. Billy and Ganz fight through the passengers getting off t train, jump on board; Billy pulls Rosalie behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Running for the doors... Suddenly, a SECURITY OFFICER appears, riot gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!  There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put it down real slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a policeman, you asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even try... now drop it or - you're all done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means it, points the riot gun even closer... The train front of him moves away. Cates carefully places the .38 on the pavement. Then rais his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN STATION
dialogues.text: Witnesses stand in nervous little knots. Give versions of what happened to notepad-toting patrolmen. Hospital Attendants minister to various and sundry complaints. Cates sits on a passenger bench, obviously dejected.  A voice comes echoing from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden, silhouetted against the light from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the bell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost them, that's what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they get away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ran.  As fast as they could. Caught a train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden watches the Morgue Personnel wheel out the body of Patrolman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one pulled the trigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian.  I was about 30 yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't get to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What a screw-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  I screwed up.  I fucked up. I messed up.  Anybody could have done better, especially you. I bet you're real good at hitting targets through crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haden starts toward the street. Looks back at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't duck the bullet Cates. Why didn't you call in for backup instead of makin' a grandstand play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad, it would've covered your ass.  Now you're in the shit and so's the department. In case you haven't noticed, this wasn't our finest hour... I told you everyone was watchin' on this one. Maybe you better start thinkin' about writin' tickets off a three wheel bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks at Haden for a moment... Turns and walks away. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: PREDMORE HOTEL
dialogues.text: Hammond across the street from Predmore. Standing in a phone booth talking into the receiver... He turns and looks acain at the hotel... Hangs up. Walks into a nearby bar. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Punk Dancers all over the floor. A rock group blasting away...("NEW SHOES" - Vocal)

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: At a back booth... A MAN (SOSNA) approaches carrying a small suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puts the suitcase down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You want to go outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, right here's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancers sliding and jerking in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.  Everybody here's looking at everybody else's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sosna pops open the suitcase. Lid shielding the contents the patrons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some real nice merchandise. All of it's clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suitcase arranged like q salesman's display case. Tightly spaced rows of handguns mounted in their holsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pockets a revolver with a deft move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How about some ammo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's loaded... I got some shells in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens another compartment. Hammond helps himself to two boxes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is clean shit.  No serial numbers and never been used...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess with me. How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.  On credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't a credit business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know that, but this is me and we're old friends. I haven't got the money so what are you gonna do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  You got no right for this kind of play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll got your money to you. No sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammonds heads for the bar. Stands next to a good-looking woman (RITA). Nods to the barkeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Vodka. With a twist. And I want to run a tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Served up. He knocks half of it back, turns to the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My name's Reggie Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big personality smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away as he takes a drink. He looks at another pretty girl (ANGELA).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. I'm Reggie Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't my night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drinks up. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD ROOM
dialogues.text: Several Detectives are working at desks. Kehoe walks into office. He moves slowly to Cates' desk and slumps down in nearby chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you...been a long day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long night, too, from what I heard ... Word's going around that in addition to losing Ganz for the second time, and in addition to Haden busting you back to Patrolman, some jig beat the crap out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, bullshit, you heard wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing came in for me yet?  No calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kehoe's phone begins to ring.  Cates watches hopefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Kehoe... Okay, hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Offers the phone to Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's for you... Ordinance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates' excitement vanishes. He takes the receiver. Kehoe begins to clean off his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Yeah, okay.  I'll be in tomorrow. That's right, you can depend on it.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams down the receiver, leans back in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bullshit red tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heading out. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to wait for a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  See you in the morning... you know, you ought to get some rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out the door. Cates stares fixedly at the phone the desk. Hoping Hammond will call... Across the room ano phone starts to ring. Cates stares at the PLAINCLOTHESMAN answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Cates... line twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates snatches up the phone, shouts into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucker, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: In the Chronicle Restaurant and Bar, a well appointed establishment off Montgomery Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at work, asshole.  Where else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine! I... I'm sorry... I was expecting somebody else... police business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder you're so popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's I'm just surprised you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, this afternoon...          Hey, look, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry about ... the way things have been lately.  I know I haven't been acting real great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Cates, Kehoe steps back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates swings around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I almost forgot.  That pal of yours from the Vice Squad wants you to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  He said he rousted a bar with you last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  Why the hell didn't you tell me before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not paid to take your personal calls.  He was in some bar. .. off duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number ... what's the Goddamn number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?  What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find it yourself.  It's on my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates speaks back into the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, I gotta put you on hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second, that's all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the bold button, starts rummaging through the des Paperwork scatters in all directions. Kehoe watches him in silence for awhile then leaves. Cate begins to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hammond... you son of a bitch, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listens for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: VROMAN'S ROCK CLUB
dialogues.text: Hammond on the phone as the band rocks away.   (MONKEY MASH - Track only)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jack, how ya doin'? What took you so long to call, man? I been waitin' ... I'm at Vroman's up in the Fillmore. Yeah, Vroman's... 'Course you don't hang out here; it's for the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there in a minute. You don't move your ass, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slams down the phone. Starts toward the door. Remembers.. He dashes back to the phone, hits the other line. Hears o a buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: VROMAN'S ROCK CLUB
dialogues.text: Band blasting away on another number (THE BOYS ARE BACK I

dialogues.speaker: TOWN
dialogues.text: Hammond now in the middle of the floor dancing his ass of with a girl named CANDY. As the song ends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Reggie Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries his big personality smile. This time gets one back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm candy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, baby, but if i don't get some action tonight, I'm gonna bust.  You interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what kind of talk is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ... You're a schoolteacher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I go to a school to learn how to do hair. It's a government program. But really I want to be a model - and I am definitely not sellin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humorously) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't you think a hair stylists got any interest in gettin' it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go sweetheart, throw it my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, i been waiting three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just quit bein' a priest or somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, baby, nothin' like that. Look, there's a place across the street. We can go right over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's gotta be here and now. Believe me. Only I don't have the damn money for a room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band starts up again. ("LOVE SONGS ARE FOR CRAZIES" -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, even us non-pros expect the guy to pay for the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates suddenly appears... steps between them. Yells above band's noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's luther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be polite. Say hello.  This is Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. And goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Hammond. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I'll see you later ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's hoping, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy leaves and melts into the crowd on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Luther?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ganz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed ... Luther took a taxi to the hotel across the street. Made a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should pay Luther a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him get some sleep.  He's going to need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) They must have set up a meeting for the morning; Luther left an 8 am wake-up and put up the "Don't Disturb" sign.  He's trading his girl for the money.  All we have to do to grab Ganz is not go blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you took the rest of the night off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have too many cheerleaders in prison. I though I might indulge myself in a little trim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates orders two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something.  Why didn't you just take the money off Luther and split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I want Ganz as bad as you do and I got some other news for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his jacket slightly. Reveals a shoulder holster accompanying .45.  A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why, but I'm going to let you keep it. Maybe because you told me you had it, or maybe just because I'm too tired to argue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure that's the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for callin' in... and I guess Maybe... Look, I'm sorry I called you Watermellon nigger... those kinds of things. I was just leanin' on ya, doin' my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bein' good at your job don't explain everything, Jack ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond gives him a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as you're feeling like Abe Lincoln, how about payin' me on our bet?  We got time and all this pussy around here's drivin' me crazy. See that one over there, the one I was with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods at Candy across the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can just take her right across the street to Luther's hotel.  All I need is some money for the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big smile as Cates produces some cash. Hammond counts it eagerly. Looks around. Candy suddenly appears like a trou seeing a lure.  She grabs the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just struck it rich... I think we can do a little business.  As a matter of fact, I think we can have a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles, leads her out of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates watches them go, downs his drink. He fishes in his pocket for a coin, moves to a wall phone. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: CHRONICLE RESTAURANT BAR
dialogues.text: A COCKTAIL WAITRESS answers the phone as Elaine pours a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands her the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams down the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Hammond and Candy exit the rock club. A line of young Pun waiting to get inside... Hammond and Candy are in a tight clinch, a little giggly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Hammond sees Luther emerge from the Predmore ac the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, not now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther moves down the street with the briefcase.  Hammond pulls Candy back inside Vroman's.

dialogues.speaker: VROMAN'S ROCK CLUB
dialogues.text: Rock group still blasting away... (LOVE SONGS ARE FOR CRAZIES - Vocal continues) Hammond and Candy reappear, knocking aside a waitress abo to refill Cates' drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you been in prison three years, it don't take long. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther's on the move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates jumps up, runs out. Hammond looks at Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll be back. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. Runs off after Cates. She stares at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: STREET LIGHT
dialogues.text: Luther checking over his shoulder for shadows, walks down block. Turns into a narrow street.

dialogues.speaker: A BUS STOP
dialogues.text: Luther waits, impatient. Checks his watch. Looks up and down the street. He double-checks the bus stop sign over his head. Just as a bus pulls to a stop, air brakes hissing ...

dialogues.speaker: LUTHER
dialogues.text: Gets in. Sees that the driver is Billy Bear...

dialogues.speaker: BUS
dialogues.text: The bus starts up. Luther hesitates in the front. On the rear seat is Ganz. Rosalie beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your coat. Both sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows he's not packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther takes a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Just show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luther puts the case on a side seat, opens it for display

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER BUS STOP
dialogues.text: Commuters look up expectantly. One of two drift toward th curb. Jump back in alarm as the bus roars by.

dialogues.speaker: BUS
dialogues.text: Ganz is satisfied. Luther closes the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalie, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talkin' about? I said I wouldn't hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he shoots Luther. Right between the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I never break my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughs as Rosalie begins to scream.

dialogues.speaker: CATES' CADDY
dialogues.text: Barreling down the street, ignoring red lights. Hammond shouts over the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Notice something funny about that bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It missed the last four stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates pours on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BEAR
dialogues.text: His eyes fall on the rear view mirror. A white Caddy danc in the vibrating glass. Billy looks over his shoulder at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz!

dialogues.speaker: THE CADDY
dialogues.text: Swerves into cross traffic, makes a big press forward. Co abreast of the driver's side of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: GANZ
dialogues.text: Smashes a side window with the two handguns. Blasts away. Cates driving with one hand as he draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Looks up as glass shards sparkle down. He speeds up ... he is neck and neck with the bus. Hammond has a clear shot of Billy Bear who gives a side glance at him; Hammond doesn't shoot... Cates slows down and fires... Billy is hit in the shoulder. Ganz runs up and fires agai Hammond is hit in the arm. Cates grabs Hammond by the shi Yanks him close. Throws the wheel over ...

dialogues.speaker: CADDY
dialogues.text: Swerves as bullets pepper the passenger side. Stuffing fl out of Hammondis still warm seat. The right hand windows explode. Then the Caddy spins out.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Roars away...

dialogues.speaker: THE CADDY
dialogues.text: Skids into a traffic sign, demolishing some newspaper machines. Cates curses, tries to start the car. The engin won't turn over. He looks at the distant bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn! Goddamn!  Goddamn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pounds on the dash. What's left of the windshield falls i the impact. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD ROOM
dialogues.text: Cates at his desk. Hammond seated nearby, now with a band arm.  Haden in front of Cates, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus, you goddamn whiskey mick cop, you lost a stolen bus... We got five deaths related to Ganz, all of 'em law enforcement related, and you blow it for a lousy nigger convict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates says nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's rights I called him a nigger.  You bet I did ... I saw the report on that little piece of shit.  If he spent one legal day in his whole life, it'd be a record...This is it for you... suspension, review board... you've had it.  When it gets 'round you protect a con rather than nail a cop killer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got more brains and more guts in one corner of his asshole than any cop I've worked with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cause you say it with conviction don't mean shit to me... How you gonna take to a pink slip, huh?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates stands. Moves to Hammond. Handcuffs himself to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where the Christ do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking my prisoner back to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond looks at Haden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' a little hard on him, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself convict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know for a man, you have very pretty brown eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond walk out.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond walk stoically along a row of cars, arr at Hammond's Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how'd my car get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it impounded.  Come on, we'll use it for haulin' you back to the slam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to jail in my own car.  Ganz got away. Got all my money. It just don't seem right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you, but I could use a drink... I'll buy you one.  It'll be my good-bye present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes off Hammond's cuffs.  Looks at them.. Throws them a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry we didn't do better, Jack. I feel like I let you down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, you didn't let me down.  It was a long shot all the way.  We gave 'em a good run at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we didn't get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in and drive off. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche blasts by ... These men want a drink. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: CHRONICLE RESTAURANT AND BAR
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond walk in. It's late, the place is almost empty. The Bartender is a woman with her back to them conferring with a waitress about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, they're closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barmaid turns around to take their order.  It's Elain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to have you and your friend thrown out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  We've had a hard night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.  Pardon me for saying so, but you look like shit.  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We and my pal here have been taking it on the chin for the last few hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond looks at her. He nudges Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Hammond, Reggie Hammond. I heard a lot about you. And any friend of Jack's is a friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gives her a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure I can say the same thing...You don't look like a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I been workin' the other side of the street for the last few years.  And you don't exactly look like a shrink, wearin' that dress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrink major, not a shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours three glasses of cognac. A STRAGGLER at the end the bar pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lady, a drink here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine turns to him; it's short and sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink your drink, pay up and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this.  It's against...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, just fuck off.  My friends have guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates holds up his pistol. The man's eyes widen and he tu his angry move toward her into a skedaddle out of the bar Elaine finishes drying a glass and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You real down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been better...Dead end.  No Ganz, no Indian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes his drink, puts down the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I gotta call the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks back at Hammond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't run off anywhere, okay? I've already got enough to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard man to live with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, two days with him is enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him carefully. They both grin.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: In the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any report ... No ... Just tell me... nothing..Yeah I figured... Okay, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE AND HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Cates returns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  No sign of Ganz.  No sign of the Indian.  Airport's clean.  Train station. Bus station.  Docks... Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz is going to be hard to track. Just a pure schizo ... wires all crossed... totally without any pattern... kill anybody... The Indian... himself... anybody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, it's all over the papers. He's an obvious type.  But this Indian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond cuts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the only one of my bunch that was my friend... He was loyal, went all the way for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all due respect, he sounds kind of pathetic to me.  The kind of guy that runs home to his momma or some girlfriend.  Have you two ace detectives checked that out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well the only woman of the Indian's we ran into was shacked up with her dyke girlfriend.  I guess she went with him before she came outta the Closet ... They both looked mad enough to kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, too bad.  They were real nice lookin' too...In bed together, hardly any clothes one watching TV...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think they were lesbians, or as you so quaintly put it, dykes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, they were a little old for a slumber party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might pay to reexamine a few of your more primitive notions.  I was in bed with a girlfriend watching TV last week, Jack, and one thing we know about me is I happen not to be a lesbian ... Now, if this Indian's girlfriend got upset when you came looking for him, it could just be she's still vulnerable to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a guy hurts you, then comes back bleeding on his hands and knees, who knows, he might just be irrestible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Come on, shrink time's over. They wouldn't go see some old girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, well look where you came when you were down and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a point there, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles. Cates reflects for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only thing we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Whaddya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I know?  I'm just a bartender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I get to kiss her too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's right, and if you don't screw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the bar. TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates and Hammond hidden in a doorway which affords them good view of the alley landing to Casey and Sally's apart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if your girl's theory turns out to be bullshit?  I mean, they could be in Rio de Janeiro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to play it rough with them. If they know anything, I'm gonna know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman appears, turning out to be Casey carrying a shopp bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there she is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever play I maker just back me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we run into Billy first, let me try and talk him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll give you a shot at it, but Ganz is mine.  You know, that big Indian plays it for keeps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I know Ganz sure ain't no sweetheart... I wouldn't like it if this partnership ended before it gets started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partnership?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got to admit we come a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates gives him a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just do it.

dialogues.speaker: APARTMENT STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: As Casey opens the door and starts toward the.stairs, Cat and Hammond come through the door and grab her. They are on the ground floor stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you've got visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time for any of that crap any more, lady... I'll rip your lungs out if you don't answer fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates has her by the shoulder and arm; he twists her like vise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Cates, knows Hammond's correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill him.  Please, just don't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the other one, you're still Billy's girls. You always were his girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure, i'm crazy in love with him, who wouldn't be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna help us take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can live or die ... You let us in and he's got a chance to make it.  Otherwise, he gets ventilated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey's face is seared with pain at the thought of Billy dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you help use he's got a chance, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's in the first room off the hall ... With rosalie ... He's makin' her happy tonight.  You don't understand about the way it is with him, do ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's ganz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back.  Down the other corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates looks at Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're gonna get your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move upward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
