dialogues.text: Cates is stealthily going to the end of the second corrid of the kitchen and living room area. That corridor turns a sharp angle and goes to the back. Hammond is at the ver front of that first corridor..at a door ... he shoves it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bed and  Rosalie, undressed, is in it... Billy seated on the edge of it... pants on, shirt off, pulling his boots. Suddenly, Hammond is pointing a gun at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, Billy.  You got no shot at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him hurt met Billy. You're not gonna let 'em hurt me, are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't hurt you.  He ain't gonna do nothin' to you, he's just after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' ya, Billy, give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never was much for bein' rehabilitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy looks at Hammond.  With lightning sudden quickness, reaches and produces a huge Bowie knife from behind his b Billy smiles, laughs...then with a sudden, awful roar, he leaps at Hamnond who unflinchingly fires his pistol.  The slugs stop Billy cold and throw him back against the bed Rosalie shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz, half-dressed, asleep, gun in hand, throws himself o the bed, pushes Sally out of the way ... opens the door a starts firing furiously down the corridor... He grabs the briefcase and runs to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates has ducked the bullets ... he is inching toward the door... He pulls it open...Ganz from the window fires another sho which almost gets him then vanishes down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally gets to her feett yelling, runs at Cates as he appe and futilely tries to hit him....He throws her down on th bed as if she were a doll ... He goes to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz peels down the fire escapes hits the ground. He stop for a second... Then Cates appears, Ganz fires a shot the starts to run. Cates keeps coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond hears the gunfire, runs out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Dives down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Hammond enters to find it empty of Ganz and Cates, only S crying hysterically ... He runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz runs out the back alley ...Cates pursues...

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Hammond runs down the stairs toward the front of the buil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz runs, turns out of an alley onto a street baked with neon light. Cates pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond runs out, turns down the adjoining street.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Following Ganz, holding him in sight, but unable to get a shot off...

dialogues.speaker: PARALLEL STREET
dialogues.text: Hammond running down a street near the one where Ganz is being chased...

dialogues.speaker: MAIN STREET
dialogues.text: Cates fires at Ganz ... Ganz ducks in a doorway...

dialogues.speaker: HAMMOND
dialogues.text: on his street hears the shot... he runs toward it, down a narrow alley between two buildings....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz hears footsteps approach from the opposite direction Cates.  They move very close to where be is crouched... i Hammond coming toward him... Ganz suddenly rolls a garbag can in his path, dropping him like a stone.

dialogues.speaker: CATES
dialogues.text: Comes toward where he expects to find Ganz... Ganz has hi arm around Hammond's throat and his gun to his ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it... you come up against me, you're gonna lose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond drops his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, cop, come on...l got something for ya... come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates comes out of the doorway from which he's fired...an comes into the middle of the street, gun up ... he puts i down when he sees Ganz with Hammond in jeopardy.  The han that's around Hammond's throat also holds the black bag. Cates walks forward, his gun down at his side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I get outta this, cop...I'm gonna live forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean...I got your gun ... I got his money... I got everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up.  He's crazy.  He'll kill us both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates still walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't try it. He's a fucking chickenshit cop. They're all fucking wimps, right, Cates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now closer to each other. Ganz holding Hammond a the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay, cop ... give me your gun and I'll let him live. Come on, Cates, you're real good at giving up your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates keeps the same methodical pace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he crouches and fires twice. Hammond twists as also fires. Ganz is hit in the collarbone and driven ten backward. His grip on Hammond drops, Hammond dives to the ground, looks at Cates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, I didn't think you'd really do it. You are crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz' gun still in his hand, but his arm useless at his s Cates is frozen in the crouch, ready to fire again. Ganz is in enormous pain holding his bleeding chest... A of childish disbelief passes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got hit.  I can't believe it. I got shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done.  End of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't gonna beg for my life. It ain't cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs at Cates full-speed, screaming, roaring, then is stopped by two more bullets that tear fist-sized holes in chest. Cates rises from his crouch. Takes his gun out of Ganz' now lifeless hand. Then goes over to Hammond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates raises the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  But I wasn't there for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did pick a real strange time to go and be brave all on your own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammond smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tryin' to get the money, Jack.  Just tryin' to build up a few points on that merit system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates smiles back, picks up the black bag as they move of TRANSITION.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE'S BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Cates in the tub, steam rushing from the water. Elaine sits on the porcelain edge as he splashes and soap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they take it back at headquarters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usual bullshit.  You make one smart move and everybody wants to be your friend... You know somethin', shootin' guys sucks. Especially compared to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting a long time to hear you say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, bein' a hard-ass all the time is a real drag, but it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out, lifts his watch from his pile of clothes the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Three more hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promised I'd turn my back while he... ah, never mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's takin' care of the same business I'll be takin' care of - soon as I dry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine smiles, leans close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I always say.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Minimal crummy hotel room accommodations... Hammond is kissing her at the door, finishing buttoning all his butt He reaches for a wallet, gives her several bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't do that.  I said I wasn't a pro, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no, I'm tryin' to be nice. Buy yourself something pretty. I'd do it, but I got to go.  I got this cop waitin' for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss... it's pretty romantic... She opens the door f him.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: She stands at the top of the stairs; as Hammond walks dow he calls back to her over his shoulder ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in six months... Maybe I'll make an honest woman of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a big sniile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll buy ya the best dinner in San Francisco...how'd that be? Then we'll go dancin', okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin'. See ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves off, still smiling, holding the black briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: on a picturesque hill above the Haight. Cates standing ne the wheel of Hammond's Porsche.  Hammond comes down the p steps from the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, reggie, start bustin' my chops... Tell me how great you were with that chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jack, real men don't have to go in for that macho bullshit ... but I was fantastic. As a riatter of fact, I was so good, I may have my cock done in bronze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates holds up the black briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this is what you want to talk about...All the pretty money that's inside here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates takes the case to the trunk, opens it, deposits the case, locks the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, Cates.  I've been waitin' three years for that.  I don't think it's fair, man. What about the merit system.? You were gonnna give me a few thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long exchange of looks. Then be hands Hammond the keys to the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's your money.  It'll be here in six months when you get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're tellin' me you don't want any of this cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Not my style, Reggie..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an awesomely weird cop. Sure wish there were more like you runnin' around out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. If I ever get word of you steppin' over the line again, I'm gonna ventilate that suit of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spare met Jack. I'm into legit investments from here on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cates gives him a very skeptical look, as they head for t car. Hammond gets in behind the wheel, Cates on the passenger Cates takes out a cigarette, starts to light it. Hammond takes the match does it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble, Jack. But, listen, suppose I stay a crook?  Where'd you get the idea that you could catch me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile. Hammond socks it into gear and they driv off into the far distance...
